text: I am a graduate student in the Neuroimaging and Informatics Master’s Program at the University of Southern California (USC). My research interests involve applying data science and machine learning to process biomedical signals, with a focus in magnetic resonance images of the brain.

I am a graduate student in the Neuroimaging and Informatics Master’s Program at the University of Southern California (USC). My research interests involve applying data science and machine learning to process biomedical signals, with a focus in magnetic resonance images of the brain.

Mar 2025 - Present Keck School of Medicine of USC, Los Angeles CA  Graduate Research Assistant 

Processing magnetic resonance brain images (NIfTI).
Implementing contrast and shape-based rules to identify and segment Lacunar infarcts in the brain.
Evaluating imaging feature sets using Logistic Regression to improve classification accuracy of lacune pathology.








Oct 2022 - Jul 2024 Massachusetts General Hospital, Boston MA  Programmer, Center for Addiction Medicine 

Data pipeline design, implementation, and optimization for large-scale clinical trial data.
Shiny app and dashboard development - automate data processing, visualization, and monitoring
Dataset harmonization (JSON and CSV) for exploratory and primary analysis.
Collaborated with Biostatistician to implement the statistical analysis plan using Linear Regression.
Report design - annual epidemiological report automatically generated with Markdown.








Bar-Ilan University, Tel-Aviv - Israel Aug 2020 - Dec 2020  Research Intern, Developmental Neuropsychology Lab 

Data processing, cleaning, and analysis for eye-tracking data to measure EEG and gaze coordination patterns using repeated measures ANOVA.

Mar 2025 - Present Keck School of Medicine of USC, Los Angeles CA  Graduate Research Assistant 

Processing magnetic resonance brain images (NIfTI).
Implementing contrast and shape-based rules to identify and segment Lacunar infarcts in the brain.
Evaluating imaging feature sets using Logistic Regression to improve classification accuracy of lacune pathology.








Oct 2022 - Jul 2024 Massachusetts General Hospital, Boston MA  Programmer, Center for Addiction Medicine

Shiny app and dashboard development - automate data processing, visualization, and monitoring
